title: How does 'true face power' work?
body:
`gpu_src_code_d = self.code_discriminator( gpu_src_code )

gpu_src_code_d_ones  = tf.ones_like (gpu_src_code_d)

gpu_src_code_d_zeros = tf.zeros_like(gpu_src_code_d)

gpu_dst_code_d = self.code_discriminator( gpu_dst_code )

gpu_dst_code_d_ones = tf.ones_like(gpu_dst_code_d)

gpu_G_loss += self.options['true_face_power']*DLoss(gpu_src_code_d_ones, gpu_src_code_d)

gpu_D_code_loss = (DLoss(gpu_src_code_d_ones , gpu_dst_code_d) +  DLoss(gpu_src_code_d_zeros, gpu_src_code_d) ) * 0.5`


Q1:
As the code shows, the true face loss can only influence the encoder, and the loss forced the src_code to be more like the dst_codeï¼Œbut why can such a loss make the result to be more like src face?

Q2:
If we exchange the src_code and the dst_code in the loss, which means making the dst_code to be more like src_code, can we also achieve the same goal that make the result to be more like src face
